name: Graphic SQL reference
tagline: Graphic SQL reference for data manipulation
body:
I don't mind text-based technical references, but they aren't for everyone.  So a graphic SQL cheat sheet may help [Confirm the Power of Visuals in eLearning](http://info.shiftelearning.com/blog/bid/350326/Studies-Confirm-the-Power-of-Visuals-in-eLearning).  In the spirit of collaboration the downloadable versions are available in PDF and PNG formats on my GitHub repository.  
![Graphic T-SQL Cheat Sheet](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kelsfarmer/SQL/master/SQL%20Data%20Manipulation%20Language%20Cheat%20Sheet.png)
The flowchart covers many common T-SQL data manipulation commands that my team uses regularly in a format that can help quickly build statements from left-to-right with fields, rows, values, etc. that are color coded for easy reference.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
